document.p: The Parental Controls functions allow you to block access to specific websites.
The Parental Controls card in the Advanced View displays:
document.li1: The status of the website blocking feature.
The number of site blocking rules that are currently defined.
document.p: To open the Parental Control page, click the Parental Controls card on the Advanced View .
The Parental Control page contains the following settings:
document.li1:
Enabled:
Allows you to enable site blocking.
After switching on site blocking, click Save before you start adding sites.

Site table:
This table allows you to add site blocking rules. The rules are in fact exceptions on the default rule. To add a new site:
document.step2: The adds a new row to the table.
Under Site type the URL of the site (e.g. facebook.com).
document.li3:
The MAC address of the device for which the exception is valid (for example, dad's computer).
You can also type in (a part of) the host name of the device. The will then display a list of devices with such a host name. If you then click one of the results, the will insert the corresponding MAC address.
All if you want this exception to be valid for all devices.
Block to block access the Site for the Device.
